derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French motif (adjective used as a noun), from late Latin motivus, from movere 'to move'

entry.def: Your motive for doing something is your reason for doing it.

means.word_mean: 1. the psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior;

sentences.sentence: "he acted with the best of motives"

means.word_mean: 2. a theme that is elaborated on in a piece of music

stems_affixes.word_buile: mot运动+ive……的→n.动机,目的 adj.发动的,运动的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 远的,遥远的,疏远的,偏僻的,细微的
stems_affixes.word_buile: re回+mot运动+e→动回去→退回去→遥远的
com共同+motion动→大家一起动→动乱
mot运动+ion表名词→n.运动,动;提议,动议
mot运动+ive……的→n.动机,目的 adj.发动的,运动的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 发动机, 电动机,汽车
stems_affixes.word_buile: mot运动+or物器→n.发动机, 电动机,汽车
motor汽车+cycle=cycl圆,环→圆,环[轮胎]占大部分的车→摩托车, 机车
promote[v.促进;提升]+ion表名词→n.促进;提升;创立
